Article.Abstract: Protective immunity to Mycobacterium tuberculosis is poorly understood, but mounting evidence, at least in animal models, implicates major histocompatibility complex class I-restricted CD8+ T cells as an essential component. By using a highly sensitive assay for single cell interferon gamma release, we screened an array of M. tuberculosis antigen-derived peptides congruent with HLA class I allele-specific motifs. We identified CD8+ T cells specific for epitopes in the early secretory antigenic target 6 during active tuberculosis, after clinical recovery and in healthy contacts. Unrestimulated cells exhibited peptide-specific interferon gamma secretion, whereas lines or clones recognized endogenously processed antigen and showed cytolytic activity. These results provide direct evidence for the involvement of CD8+ cytotoxic T lymphocytes in host defense against M. tuberculosis in humans and support current attempts to generate protective cytotoxic T lymphocyte responses against M. tuberculosis by vaccination.
Article.ArticleTitle: Human cytolytic and interferon gamma-secreting CD8+ T lymphocytes specific for Mycobacterium tuberculosis.
Article.Affiliations: Molecular Immunology Group, Institute of Molecular Medicine, Nuffield Department of Clinical Medicine, University of Oxford, John Radcliffe Hospital, Oxford OX3 9DU, United Kingdom.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Freshly isolated PBMC were taken from a donor with tuberculous mediastinal lymphadenitis and acute erythema nodosum. Tuberculin skin test showed 25 mm induration 48hours after intradermal injection of 1 tuberculin unit of purifiedprotein derivative. In addition, a very high antibody titer in response to the 16 kDa antigen of M. tuberculosis,helped to confirm active infection.

Tuberculin skin test showed 25 mm induration 48hours after intradermal injection of 1 tuberculin unit of purifiedprotein derivative. In addition, a very high antibody titer in response to the 16 kDa antigen of M. tuberculosis,helped to confirm active infection.

The CD8+ clones were isolated from a donor with tuberculous mediastinal lymphadenitis and acute erythema nodosum. Tuberculin skin test showed 25 mm induration 48hours after intradermal injection of 1 tuberculin unit of purifiedprotein derivative. In addition, a very high antibody titer in response to the 16 kDa antigen of M. tuberculosis,helped to confirm active infection.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The peptide sequence is congruent with the peptide motif of HLA-B52.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Freshly isolated PBMC were taken from two donors: one with tuberculous mediastinal lymphadenitis and acute erythema nodosum, and a second with tuberculous osteomyelitis.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The peptide sequence is congruent with the peptide motif of HLA-B52.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: The CD8+ clones were isolated from two tuberculosis patients.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The peptide sequence is congruent with the peptide motif of HLA-B52. No response was observed using HLA-B52-mismatched target cells.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: The CD8+ clone was isolated from a tuberculosis patients.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The peptide sequence is congruent with the peptide motif of HLA-B52. No response was observed using HLA-B52-mismatched target cells.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Freshly isolated PBMC were taken from a donor with tuberculous mediastinal lymphadenitis and acute erythema nodosum. Tuberculin skin test showed 25 mm induration 48hours after intradermal injection of 1 tuberculin unit of purifiedprotein derivative. In addition, a very high antibody titer in response to the 16 kDa antigen of M. tuberculosis,helped to confirm active infection.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: CD8+ depletion resulted in a loss of the response. The peptide sequence is congruent with the peptide motif of HLA-B52.

FirstInVivoProcess.InVivoProcessType: Documented exposure without evidence for disease

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Freshly isolated PBMC were taken from a healthy tuberculosis contact.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: CD8+ depletion resulted in a loss of the response. The peptide sequence is congruent with the peptide motif of HLA-B52.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Freshly isolated PBMC were taken from a tuberculosis-infected donor.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The peptide sequence is congruent with the peptide motif of HLA-B52.
